programme.title: Killer Animal Tactics

programme.title: Predator Fail: When Prey Attacks

programme.title: Secret Life Of Predators: Compilation

programme.title: Wild Hunters: Deadly Killers of Africa

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol

programme.title: Prairie Dog Manor
programme.desc: The Prairie Dogs of northern New Mexico deal with all kinds of threats, big and small. In the Flatlands, June faces an infestation of fleas.

programme.title: The Hidden Kingdoms Of China
programme.desc: China's vast grasslands are a hard place to survive. Battered by ferocious and unpredictable storms throughout the year, the inhabitants of these grasslands have to be adaptable and tenacious to survive. During the short three-month window of summer, the plains residents have to race against time to raise their young before the onset of autumn and winter begin.

programme.title: Extraordinary Australia
programme.desc: Australias coastline is a true natural wonder, encompassing a diverse range of bountiful habitats. Coastal seas and lands are realms of epic migrations, mesmerising mating rituals and high stakes battles between predator and prey. .

programme.title: The Hidden Kingdoms Of China
programme.desc: China's bamboo forest is full of secrets and surprises, including the legendary giant panda, red panda and Tibetan macaque, and a host of other unusual creatures such as the jewelled flower mantis, bamboo bats and moustached toads that have found ingenious ways to survive in this kingdom of giant grass.

programme.title: The Hidden Kingdoms Of China

programme.title: The Hidden Kingdoms Of China

Phil first encounters the yellow-bellied glider, an intrepid marsupial with a built-in wingsuit. Next is one of Australia‚Äôs most abundant but deadly reptiles, the eastern brown snake. Last but certainly not least, Phil finds the iconic, cuddly and oh-so-sleepy koala.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Dr. Pol treats three bovines and one tiny rabbit before heading to the Netherlands with Diane to celebrate his 80th birthday. Just because the Docs away, it doesnt mean that the clinic slows down. A very vocal pig needs surgery to treat a hernia, a blocked cat is in pain and requires immediate relief, and a puppy is feeling the effects of eating something inedible. .

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: The clinic is slammed with summertime cases as the vets battle to save a badly injured cat, a farm dog with a puncture wound, and a wobbling mini horse struggling to walk. The team is seeing double as pairs of ferrets and chickens come through the door. Doc and Dianes new puppy brings chaos and cuteness to the clinic.

programme.title: Wild India
programme.desc: In India‚Äôs deserts, predators and prey battle each other and the harshest of landscapes for food, water, and breeding rights. Leopards, lions, wolves, foxes and hyenas have adapted to face the brutal challenges of surviving here. Yet every year, extreme drought and searing heat test them to their limits.

programme.title: Wild India
programme.desc: India's monsoon forest is a place of both sanctuary and extremes. From the dry season drought to the monsoon deluge, all must live by the law of the seasons. Whether migrating, raising young or defending against predators, every day is a quest for survival. As the dry season tightens its grip, only the most ingenious and resourceful will endure until the lifesaving rains return.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Indigenous educator Phil Breslin journeys down Australia‚Äôs rivers to find which riparian animal is most built to survive. His first encounter is with the duck-billed platypus, a peculiar and adorable monotreme, or egg-laying mammal. Phil then gets a grip on the ultra-slimy long-finned eel and learns of its extraordinary reproductive habits before finally catching a river-dwelling bull shark.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Indigenous educator Phil Breslin ventures into Australia‚Äôs notorious wetlands to discover three animals built for the muggy and wet environment. Phil comes face to face with the uniquely Australian freshwater crocodile, a massive predatory fish called the barramundi, and the saltwater crocodile, one of the world‚Äôs most dangerous animals and largest reptiles.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Indigenous educator Phil Breslin heads along the cliffs and sandy flats of the Australian coast to discover which animal dominates the shoreline. His first encounter is with a white -bellied sea eagle, a bird with extremely sharp talons, followed by the estuarine stonefish, the most venomous fish in the world. Finally, Phil takes a closer look at the notorious stingray.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Indigenous educator Phil Breslin heads into the constant heat, humidity and rainfall of the Australian rainforests to find out what it takes to be ‚ÄúBuilt to Survive.‚Äù In the leafy canopy, Phil encounters the elusive tree kangaroo and its young joey, as well as Australia‚Äôs largest snake, the lethal scrub python. On the forest floor, the colorful cassowary acts as the rainforest‚Äôs gardener.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Within the Channel Country deserts, Indigenous educator Phil Breslin scours the endless sands to find three animals that not only survive the heat but thrive in unrelenting conditions. Get ready to meet Australia‚Äôs most impressive animals: the perentie, the continent‚Äôs largest lizard; the emu, its fastest flightless bird; and the mighty red kangaroo, the world‚Äôs largest marsupial.

programme.title: Out There With Jack Randall
programme.desc: Fearless wildlife zoologist Jack Randall dives head first into a marine mystery: are majestic green sea turtles adapting to the devastating conditions of Australia‚Äôs dying Great Barrier Reef? While joining forces with a dedicated team of daring scientists, Jack dodges bull rays, snatches nurse sharks and wrangles dugongs.
